bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 22 (Tuesday, February 5, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. CICILLINE:H.R. 965.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:ARTICLE 1, SECTION 8.[Page H1362]

item.title: H.R. 965, CREATES Act of 2019
item.description: As ordered reported by the House Committee on Energy and Commerce on April 3, 2019

item.title: H.R. 965, CREATES Act of 2019
item.description: As ordered reported by the House Committee on the Judiciary on April 30, 2019

item.name: Drug safety, medical device, and laboratory regulation

summary.text:
Creating and Restoring Equal Access to Equivalent Samples Act of 2019 or the CREATES Act of 2019

This bill generally allows the developer of a drug or biological product, such as a generic or biosimilar version of a drug, to bring a civil action against the license holder of an approved medication if the holder refuses to make available sufficient quantities of the approved medication for the developer's testing. The bill also establishes affirmative defenses to such a civil action.

In addition, the bill authorizes drug manufacturers seeking Food and Drug Administration approval for a generic drug to use alternative methods to develop elements assure safe use of a drug.

Creating and Restoring Equal Access to Equivalent Samples Act of 2019 or the CREATES Act of 2019

This bill generally allows the developer of a drug or biological product, such as a generic or biosimilar version of a drug, to bring a civil action against the license holder of an approved medication if the holder refuses to make available sufficient quantities of the approved medication for the developer's testing. The bill also establishes affirmative defenses to such a civil action.

In addition, the bill authorizes drug manufacturers seeking Food and Drug Administration approval for a generic drug to use alternative methods to develop elements assure safe use of a drug.

Creating and Restoring Equal Access to Equivalent Samples Act of 2019 or the CREATES Act of 2019

This bill generally allows the developer of a drug or biological product, such as a generic or biosimilar version of a drug, to bring a civil action against the license holder of an approved medication if the holder refuses to make available sufficient quantities of the approved medication for the developer's testing. The bill also establishes affirmative defenses to such a civil action.

In addition, the bill authorizes drug manufacturers seeking Food and Drug Administration approval for a generic drug to use alternative methods to develop elements assure safe use of a drug.

bill.title: CREATES Act of 2019

item.title: Creating and Restoring Equal Access to Equivalent Samples Act of 2019
To promote competition in the market for drugs and biological products by facilitating the timely entry of lower-cost generic and biosimilar versions of those drugs and biological products.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
